recipesJson.name: Morning Wood
recipesJson.author: JenniferJarvis
recipesJson.description: It's a different take on RY4. Smooth creamy vanilla, adds warmth and body. Red Burley is the best for being accepting of most accompanying aromas, oakwood adds a nice woody note, and well graham cracker and zeppola...can't really go wrong with that combo as a bakery note. After doing a few tests with playing around with the percentages, I find myself coming back to the original recipe and preferring it to other versions. If you want a bit more of a graham forward taste, add in 0.75% FLV Graham Cracker, but other than that I pretty much like it as is. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- photo credit: BaboMike Feminine Penis via photopin (license)

reviews.text: Not bad, not bad.  Pretty good with my morning coffee the last few days. I did sub the FLV Graham at a higher %.

Two week steep.  Very nice vanilla bakery tobacco.  Creamy vanilla graham cracker notes up front with a subtle tobacco note.  This is very well balanced.  True to the description of a vanilla Ry4 type recipe.  Iâ€™m not real big into tobacco vapes, but I really like this one.  Great job.
This is simply delicious. Needs a week to steep but it's worth it. The vanilla and the bakeries are really bringing out the chocolate notes in the tobacco for me. I love it!

Give this about week to steep. It develops into a wonderfully woodsy warm vanilla tobacco that's remarkably full-flavored for such low %s used. I don't know why it's listed as a "work in progress" - it tastes finished to me, with no sign of room for improvement. Not too sweet, not too dry, just terrific. I can definitely enjoy this Morning Wood all day.
